page.title: 01POPULATION
page.content: The population at the last census in 1981 was 843 but a 1985 count of the residents gives a figure nearer 1100. Since 1950's there has been a gradual increase in the demand for houses as West Linton is a very desirable commuter village that attracts people with executive and professional occupations who like to work in the city and live in the country. The village is only 7 miles from Penicuik and 16 miles from Edinburgh. As well as many local Scottish people we have many English people who work for large international firms,government departments etc. We also have people living here from Wales and Ireland. Nearly all the people are British. We have no ethnic minorities.
